alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 2:29PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN KIMBLE COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM CDT... At 228 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 7 miles southeast of I-10 Near The Sutton-kKmble County Line, or 8 miles south of Roosevelt, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Telegraph, Segovia, South Llano River State Park, Us- 377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line, I-10 Near The Kimble- Kerr County Line, The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290, and Us- 83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 459 and 477. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
